DOCUMENTATION

Introduction Installation & Setup Real-world Workflows Troubleshooting

Installation Guide

1

Download Laragon

Get the latest version from the official website. Choose "Full" for a complete stack (Apache, MySQL, PHP, Node.js) or "Lite" for a minimal setup.

2

Run Installer

Run the setup file and click Next. Choose an installation location (Avoid paths with special characters).

3

Configure Options

Select "Run Laragon When Windows Starts" for convenience and "Auto Virtual Hosts" to get pretty URLs (e.g., app.test) automatically.

Important Installation Notes

System Requirements

Windows 7/8/10/11 (64-bit). Extremely low resource usage.

Full vs Lite

Use Full for instant setup. Use Lite if you prefer customizing tools yourself.

Location

Install anywhere, but avoid spaces or special characters in the path.

Virtual Hosts

Enabled by default. Makes accessing local projects much easier.

Auto-start

Optional. Starts Laragon automatically when Windows boots.

MySQL Backup

Laragon includes auto-backup for data safety.

DOCUMENTATION

Introduction Installation & Setup Real-world Workflows Troubleshooting

Real-world Workflows

Create a New Laravel Project

Menu > Quick app > Laravel

Name your project (e.g., "my-api")

Wait for Composer to finish. Access at http://my-api.test

Migrate from XAMPP to Laragon

Moving is easy. You just need to move your files and export/import your database.

1

Move Files

Copy folders from C:\xampp\htdocs to C:\laragon\www.

2

Export Database (in XAMPP)

Open phpMyAdmin in XAMPP, go to Export, and save the .sql file.

3

Import Database (in Laragon)

Start Laragon. Open HeidiSQL (Database button). Right click > Load SQL file.

DOCUMENTATION

Introduction Installation & Setup Real-world Workflows Troubleshooting

Troubleshooting Common Errors

Apache fails to start (Port 80 occupied)

Skype or VMWare might be using port 80. Go to Preferences > Services & Ports and change Apache port to 8080.

MySQL 8.0 cannot start

Check if you have another MySQL instance running (e.g., from XAMPP). Stop it and try again. Or check data/mysql/error.log.

Pretty URLs not working

Ensure you clicked "Start All" which reloads the hosts file. You might need to approve the UAC prompt.

Laragon

Crafted with care, driven by passion, and built for everyone, Laragon is the ultimate solution for entrepreneurs and developers who value their time. Laragon offers a streamlined development environment that works out-of-the-box, eliminating the hassle of complex setups. It's the perfect solution to help you focus on what matters most: creating, building, and innovating without wasting time on configuration.
